subject: Re: Pop Ups Blocked on Site

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Hi Sophie, 

Ok sure, confirming we have updated the below for you. I also adjusted the events tracking as well. Please check the stats after 24 hours.

Hi Heath,

After chatting with the team we've decided it is best to avoid this pop up issue and we will add in the extra download page, as you've suggested.

Could you please have a look at this today and add that page in?

Thanks,

Sophie

Hi Heath,

Sorry I thought I had replied!

Thanks for that info, just talking it through with the team. But I think if we add the extra page in it's more likely for us to lose people at that extra step, so we'll probably keep it as is.

Once I've chatted with the team in more detail I'll come back to you 😊

Sophie

Hi Sophie,

Just checking in to make sure you received the below?

Hi Sophie, 

I just tried to call you to talk you through this. The setups between the Gift in Wills page and Impact Report are actually different. The Gift in Wills page requires you to submit the form in order to download the PDF. 

The only way around this setup would be:

  1. The User fills in the form and clicks 'submit'.
  2. A new page loads and there is a link for them to 'click to download' + they are sent the existing email. 
  3. They download and view/save. 

So the difference is instead of the instant download a new page would load and then they would need to click to download. Let me know if you would like us to do it this way? Please note, this would enable someone to share the 'download' page, effectively skipping the form submissions stage. I suspect it would be highly unlikely that someone would to that anyway.

Let me know what you think?

Hi Heath,

Yes, aware that this is usually the case, but as it's working for the Impact Report and not for the Gift in Wills booklet it seems very strange (these pages are both set up the same).

We also tried on our personal laptops where we would not have pop ups blocked, and it said the website was causing the block.

Is there anything you can look into as a setting?

Thanks,

Sophie

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Pending

full_threads.body:
Hi Sophie,

The blocking of pop ups is determined by the users browser settings, not by the website.

For those users that are blocking popups, they will still receive the email with the link to download the brochure.

Hope that clarifies? Thanks,

Heath Maguire
DIRECTOR

Phone: 1300 072 134
Mobile: 0415 162 271
Email: heath@wpperk.com

action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,


We're investigating a pop up issue on the website on the gift in wills page - https://msra.org.au/ways-to-donate/gifts-in-wills/

When we go to download the brochure, pop ups are blocked and preventing the opening of the PDF in a new tab, which is interrupting the user journey.

We've tested on multiple browsers (Chrome and Firefox) and it's still a pop up issue. We've also tested on the Impact Report Page, and this one is working. So it seems there has been a setting changed on the Gift in Wills page.

Can you please let me know if there has been a setting change, and turn this back to not blocking pop ups.

Thanks,


Sophie
Sophie Hodge
Digital Marketing Coordinator
MS Research Australia
